discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Since owner has read/write and everyone else has read-only a chmod wouldn't help or be necessary here, a setenforce (C) would allow you to swap between enforcing/permissive modes to see if SELinux policies are preventing read.

Selected Answer: C
The output seems to indicate that the OS is protected with SELinux and probably sudo setenforce 0 can be used to put it in permissive mode

choices.D: Creating a copy of any important files

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Creating a snapshot

questions.question_text: A virtual server that is hosting a legacy line-of-business application has been identified for a critical patch application. Which of the following should be performed prior to the patch?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. # (hash symbol)

In PowerShell scripts, the hash symbol (#) is used to write comments or text descriptions per line. Comments are ignored by PowerShell and are useful for adding explanations or annotations within the script.

questions.question_text: Which of the following symbols is used to write a text description per line within a PowerShell script?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In order of least to most computationally intensive RAID levels:
0, 1, 10, 5, 6
0 doesn't offer protection if a disc fails, 1 isn't listed, so RAID 10 (C)

questions.question_text: A systems administrator is provisioning a SQL server with a RAID controller. The management team requires that the server be able to withstand at least a single hard drive failure, but the administrator is concerned that a computationally intensive RAID level may reduce server performance. Which of the following should the administrator choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The assumption is that the new drive has already been initialized.

choices.B: Configure the drive as a dynamic disk.
choices.A: Configure the drive as a basic disk.
